Posts.Content: Jan 19, 2009 01:26AM lencass wrote: Hi Kerrymac, I finished my FEC adventure in December. I had the exact same reaction to it as you did.  I did Taxotere first and didnt have nausea but FEC was a different story. With FEC I was on 3 anti-nausea drugs for my first round  and still had to go in to get re-hydrated.  But for the 2nd round the nurses and I talked quite a bit and changed my strategy.  I ended up taking fewer types of drugs but more frequently which made all the difference,
Posts.Title: Starting FEC-T tomorrow.... KerryMac pip57

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2009 07:43PM lencass wrote: Please Please get a second opinion.  I had pain and discomfort and went for ultrasound and mammo which came back negative.   I 'lived with it" and ignored my instinct that something was wrong and ended up delaying my treatment by a year.   It will be better to know what it is.....    telling you to live with it is not much a medical solution.     Linda's right - better to push now and be told you're fine rather than sit and worry.
Posts.Title: just not sure what to do... jennyjenn ecm
